sentences.sContent: It allowed Hebrew society and Judaism to strengthen for another crucial century—by which time the Babylonian king Nebuchadrezzar could banish the Hebrew people but not obliterate them or their faith.
sentences.sContent_eng: It allowed Hebrew society and Judaism to strengthen for another crucial century—by which time the Babylonian king Nebuchadrezzar could banish the Hebrew people but not obliterate them or their faith.
sentences.sCn: 它使得希伯莱社会和犹太教在关键的一个世纪内不断强大。 在这重要的时间内，巴比伦王尼布甲尼最多撒流放希伯莱人，而无法消灭他们，抑或扼杀他们的信仰。

sentences.sContent: But in 597 and 586 B.C., the Babylonian Empire conquered the Israelites, and the Ark, at the time supposedly stored in the Temple in Jerusalem, vanished from history.
sentences.sContent_eng: But in 597 and 586 B.C., the Babylonian Empire conquered the Israelites, and the Ark, at the time supposedly stored in the Temple in Jerusalem, vanished from history.
sentences.sCn: 但巴比伦王国分别在公元前597年和586年征服了以色列人。 据推测约柜当时就藏于耶路撒冷的圣殿之中，之后就从历史中烟消云散了。

trans.tranCn: 巴比伦人(的), 巴比伦语（的）
trans.tranOther: an inhabitant of ancient Babylon or Babylonia
